chineseMeaning: adj. 施舍的；慈善的；接受接济的;
adj. 象的；巨大的；粗笨的;
examples: Their daughter is quite plump but their son is positively elephantine.
The detectives tried to elicit where he had hidden his loot.
I could elicit no response from him.
At last we have elicited the truth from him.
He succeeded in eliciting the information he needed from her.
There is no need for him to elucidate.
I will try to elucidate what I think the problems are.
Please elucidate the reasons for your action.
This is the aspect that China does not explain or elucidate in public forums.

chineseMeaning: adj. 欺诈的；不正的；不诚实的;
examples: This geographic split could be a serious problem for Mexico, if any strife develops in the south over the perception that the election was fraudulent.
In a frenzy of hate he killed his enemy.
They were singing in a frenzy of joy.
His frenzy of the previous day had all calmed down.
The speaker worked the crowd up into a frenzy.
She worked herself up into a frenzy because she thought she'd miss her train.

chineseMeaning: n. 责任；债务；倾向；可能性；不利因素;
examples: He admitted his liability for the accident.
The judge exempted them from all liability in these matters.
If your liabilities exceed your assets, you may go bankrupt.
But the court ruled in favour of Wilson Parking due to a liability disclaimer printed at the entrance.
The answer is affirmative, and the genetic liability of mental development arrearage is very big.
Taking extra vitamins may reduce your liability to colds.
Lack of education was a liability in getting a job.

chineseMeaning: n. 化妆舞会；伪装; v. 伪装;
examples: We want to join in the masquerade.
They were all dressed up to attend the masquerade.
Her sorrow is just a masquerade.
You'll be a negotiating maven if you do this.
The results show that market maven personality is the most important factor.

chineseMeaning: adj. 可渗透的；可穿透的;
examples: The skin of amphibians is permeable to water.
Permeable pavement is not very good for roads with a lot of traffic.
At last, it gives this fixtures clinic curative effect and peroration.
They persecute those who do not conform to their idea.
They came to America after being persecuted for their religious beliefs.
Once the affair became public, he was persecuted by the press.
He persecuted me with various delicate questions.
I put him in the septic tank.
The leading cause of death was septic shock.

chineseMeaning: n. 后遗症；继发性的后果;
examples: Does laser treat myopia to there is sequela?
Drink 2 times can gastrorrhagia have sequela?
The desert was edged with sere vegetation.
A sere on uncovered rock is a lithosere.

chineseMeaning: adj. 安详的；宁静的；平静的;  Serene.; adj. 尊贵的;
examples: His serene smile calmed all of us down.
The story took place in a serene summer night.
It was a beautiful morning, calm and serene.
Light music fills my heart with serene joyfulness.
A translucent design was impressed on the paper.
She is wearing her translucent pajamas.

chineseMeaning: n. 横贯；横木; v. 横贯；穿越；详细讨论；阻止；否认；【计】遍历;
examples: The railway traverses hundreds of miles of desert.
The traverse across the country will be long and arduous.
The traverse in the room was easily seen from the doorway.

chineseMeaning: adj. 背信弃义的；背叛的；不可靠的；危险的;
examples: You treacherous cur!
He is treacherous to his friends.
My memory is treacherous.

chineseMeaning: n. 乡下佬；土包子；土老帽儿;
examples: But George Bailey is not a common,ordinary yokel.
The posters brought in the yokels from fifty miles around every whistle-stop we played.
The clothes makes him look like a slack-jaw yokel.

chineseMeaning: n. 热心者；狂热者;  Zealot: 犹太教的狂热信徒.;
examples: The artistic zealot devoted his life to the completion of a great masterpiece.
Yet a zealot is far more than the technology he bears.
He had created a stir unlike any other zealot with messianic tendencies.
